bioghist.p: Helen Morris Beitler (1915-2002) was a collector of books and 19th and early 20th century ephemera. Her areas of interest included the trades and tools, children's literature, boating, advertising, and Philadelphia and Pennsylvania history.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of ephemera collected by Helen Beitler and papers relating to her family. Family papers include materials related to the Cuyler, Morris, Wistar, Remington, Pim, and Beekman families. These records include: correspondence, much of it between Beitler's parents; photographs; home movies; and estate papers. This collection is complemented by a large number of books in which Ms. Beitler flagged and annotated passages relating to her ancestors. Ephemera in the collection includes broadsides, postcards, billheads and envelopes, programs, advertisements, calendars, almanacs, photographs and cabinet cards, sheet music, and newspapers. Topics include horses and dogs, boats, the print and paint industries, and Philadelphia history. Much of the ephemera is from the mid-19th century to the mid-20th century. There is also manuscript material (in particular, several nineteenth-century ledgers) and books relating to Pennsylvania but not directly related to Ms. Beitler's family.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
